summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center detailing a possible suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019. The report describes the incident, Epstein's behavior, and his allegations that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, attempted to kill him and had been harassing him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who allegedly attempted suicide and later claimed his cellmate tried to kill him. He was found lying on the floor of his cell with a red neck and was placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who reported finding Epstein with a string around his neck. Epstein later accused him of attempting to kill him and harassing him.

persons.name: Clarke
persons.context: Officer who spoke with the reporting lieutenant and relayed that Epstein was alert and had made allegations against his cellmate.

connections.description: Were housed together in the same cell. Epstein accused Tartaglione of attempting to kill him and harassing him.

events.title: Possible Suicide Attempt by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell lying on the floor, breathing heavily and snoring, with a red neck. He was placed on suicide watch and later alleged his cellmate tried to kill him.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell in a possible suicide attempt, with a red neck and marks consistent with a ligature.
Epstein later alleged to Officer Clarke that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had attempted to kill him and had been harassing him, and that he had informed his attorney of this matter.
Tartaglione reported finding Epstein with a string around his neck and called for guards.
Epstein exhibited unpredictable behavior on suicide watch, including pretending to fall head-first off the bed.
Medical staff later examined Epstein and noted a circular line of erythema at the base of his neck with friction marks.
